intro: Pectis domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican pectis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pectis domingensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role in its native environment.
